member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.AlarmsAndConditions.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contains classes for Alarms and Conditions in OPC Unified Architecture (OPC-UA).
member.remarks: Do not confuse this namespace with >OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents namespace, which deals with OPC-DA "Classic" specification, not with OPC-UA.

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.Application.EasyUAApplication
member.summary: A component that allows management of the OPC UA application.

remarks.para: This object is a semi-singleton, i.e. all instances of it share the same data.
For OPC UA client operations, such as access to Global Discovery Server (GDS) and Certificate Management (CM), this component uses the shared instance of the client object, i.e. .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This method or property does not throw any exceptions, aside from execution exceptions such as or .

member.param: OPC-UA application object to copy from.

This is a usage error, i.e. it will never occur (the exception will not be thrown) in a correctly written program. Your code should not catch this exception.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.Application.EasyUAApplication.Instance
member.summary: An instance of the OPC-UA Windows application class.

remarks.para: This method or property does not throw any exceptions, aside from execution exceptions such as or .

For OPC UA client operations, such as access to Global Discovery Server (GDS) and Certificate Management (CM), this component uses the shared instance of the client object, i.e. EasyUAClient.SharedInstance.
This method or property does not throw any exceptions, aside from execution exceptions such as or .

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.FileTransfer.EasyUAFileTransferClient
member.summary: A client object specialized for OPC UA file transfer operations.

remarks.para: The "file transfer" in the name corresponds to how the related OPC UA specification part is titled. In reality, the functionality covers more than just file transfer - it represents a file system in OPC UA, and provides file access and manipulation operations.
See OPC UA File Transfer Concepts for basic information about what is OPC UA File Transfer and how it works.

See OPC UA File Transfer internals for more information about some internal functionality aspects such as:
Object type checking
Connection locking
Stream buffering
Stream expansion
Read/write chunking
Read/write size limits
Adaptive read/write sizes
Metadata caching and model changes

overloads.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This method or property does not throw any exceptions, aside from execution exceptions such as or .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Initializes a new instance as a copy of an existing client object.
member.param: The OPC UA file transfer client to be copied from.

member.summary: This namespace contains classes that facilitate easy work with OPC Unified Architecture (OPC-UA) PubSub. It also contains the most important extension classes.

summary.para: The EasyUASubscriber object is the main object that allows simple access to OPC-UA PubSub publishers.

para.strong: The core members of this object come from the interface.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: Subscriber object to copy from.

member.param: Configuration to bind to.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.PubSub.EasyUASubscriber.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Required for Windows.Forms Class Composition Designer support
member.param: The component container to which the new instance will be added.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.PubSub.EasyUASubscriber.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.
member.param: The SerializationInfo that holds the serialized object data.
The StreamingContext that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.PubSub.EasyUASubscriber.Create
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.PubSub.EasyUASubscriber.SharedInstance
member.summary: A shared instance of the subscriber object.

remarks.para: Use this property with care, as its usability is limited. Its main use is for testing, and for non-library application code where just a single instance is sufficient.
The shared instance is not suitable for Windows Forms or similar environments, where a specific may be used with each form.

We also do not recommend using the shared instance for library code, due to conflicts that may arise if your library sets some instance parameters which may not be the same as what other libraries or the final application expects.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.PubSub.EasyUASubscriber.DeepClone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a deep copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new object that is a deep copy of this instance.
